title: Why no woman will ever date/want me...
text:
because I'm an unemployed depressed loser who can't get his life together, and doesn't own a car. Still lives at home, and for the life of him is afraid to even go outside sometimes.
It's pathetic that I'm 27, and can't find a way out of this cycle, because I'm too afraid. 

There's always the same compliments: I'm very nice, and sweet.

You're lazy get a job! 
Sure thing. Let me just turn off my anxiety, and the constant feeling of worthlessness. 
Let's turn off my brain too so I can escape from myself. 
I guess it is really lazy when you're occasionally battling thoughts that shouldn't be there. 

Self-harm? Sure why not.

It has taken me until now to realize that maybe a relationship just isn't the best thing for me.
It's a price to pay. The loneliness will be a constant reminder. 

You fall asleep faster crying to yourself.
The bed becomes your best friend.
Even now I want to lay down, and soon I will.

I'd love to feel wanted. 

Some of the posts I read call for everything I'm not.
No ones looking for me, and I don't blame them.

I don't feel sorry for myself. 
I can't control these feelings I get. 

At the end of the day I'm just tired of having no one there for me. 
I've convinced myself of being a broken mess.

No one likes cleaning messes.

title: Native New Yorker looking for artistic type friends from Chicago :-)
text:
Hey everyone,

I never did this before but I think I should get straight to the point.

I am Brooklyn-born woman, looking to either meet women I can grow and be friends with. It's difficult for me to socialize at times due to work but that is changing. Plus most of my friends are on the East Coast so I do feel a bit lonely, to be honest. If you are a person in the arts (music, painting, sculpting, graffiti, etc) it would be awesome. If you're not, no worries, it's all good. I would like to meet people for long term friendships, go out, chill out, have fun and enjoy life!

About me:

I'm Bajan-American, hoping to start learning music production and other instruments soon but right now, I just pay bills :-D I am a picky eater, but if you can convince me to be more adventurous in that, it would be pretty awesome. I don't smoke or drink. I don't think I can hang with a smoker but if you drink socially that would be cool with me. I don't mind getting a glass of wine once in a while. 420 friendly as well, and I'm still trying to smoke it properly- Hahahahaaa! 

I love music a great deal, all of it but some of my faves are Siouxsie and the Banshees, System of a Down, Nas, Tupac, Little Dragon, old r&b, reggae, pop, etc. We don't have to have the same taste in music, though. I love movies but don't watch enough of it and I like to cook and try out recipes. I love to read (which I'm slipping with that) and having great conversations, going out, etc. I also love to workout.

I want to be able to talk to my new found friends and I hope they feel comfortable speaking to me. I am great at listening. I do have a dog, just so you know.

So with that said, so I don't get spam, please put on the subject line, "Art" when replying. Let's start getting to know each other via email and be happy and have fun! Oh, please be between the ages of 30-38.

Thanks and I hope to hear from you soon!

title: Do you enjoy museums, movies, art shows?
text:
Hi, Thanks for reading my post. I'm early 50's divorced with grown kids and looking to start a long term relationship with a married female friend. I'm not looking to change anyone's situation, but hoping to find one special person to be a friend, confidant and ultimately a lover. 

I'm a working business professional, so I'd like you to be a working professional as well. I have flexibility during the day to meet and would like to do so on a weekly basis at first for coffee, or walks or cuddling and eventually for something more. It would work out well if you had daytime availability also. I am a father and a person and want to talk about my day, my life and hear about your day and your life as well. I'm not looking for sob stories or complainers, but am looking for someone who knows how to communicate and is open to communicating and sharing. Texting is great, throw in some emails and phone calls and you've just hit a home run. I understand the need for discretion and I trust that you do as well. I'm not into playing games and I'm not looking to be with someone who is a game player.

On to looks.... looks are important to all of us, but at 50 we need to be realistic about what we are dealing with. I'm not looking for a underwear model, nor should you be looking for a Bachelor contestant. I'm looking for an average early 40's and older woman; I'm really not impressed by tattoos, piercings or the totally clean shaven body. I am a black man, 6'3 190 beard when I do not shave and mustache. 

I am normal, and very down to earth. My current relationship isn't the greatest. If it was, I wouldn't be here. Ideally, your normal and down to earth as well in a similar place in your relationship. I do miss the intimacy of a relationship and look forward to getting to that point again, however, I am not looking to rush into that immediately. If you would like to send a face or total body picture that is fine. If not, I understand discretion. I really hope that we can build a long term relationship that brightens each other's day amidst the chaos of life.

Tell me something about you and ask me a question about me......

title: Looking for friendship

We weren't romantically involved, but we spent a lot of time together going to concerts, the ballet (she was a classical dancer)... we had dinners together, went for long walks along Lake Michigan. I just found out that she passed away from cancer. She was a lovely woman, and I miss her. I don't know why we didn't keep in touch. I guess that's what I'm looking for, someone to spend time with, do fun and interesting things with... someone kind and smart and funny... I am a college English instructor and have also done technical writing and technical training. I'm a fit 61 and healthy. I love to ride my bike. title: As basic a seeking a friend (Lets try this again)
text:
You know, how it used to be back in the day. Just go out, do SOMETHING, anything, talk about daily life or personal issues. Nothing convoluted or with any ulterior motive or intent behind it. Too many people try to engage you with an agenda nowadays in the indirect hope of getting something else out of you.

People that need not apply? Those who don't put in the effort or who aren't aware of the situation they're putting themselves in. I'm from New York, so developing somewhat of a social life out here, being new and all, is difficult.

Please be within the Bolingbrook/Woodridge/Naperville area, preferably, close to, or in Bolingbrook. I've lived on public transit, my own two feet, or my own mobile mode of transportation my entire life; so I don't yet currently own or drive a vehicle. But that's a real work in progress. If it comes to a real social situation, I'm not opposed to negotiating methods of meeting. I'll make my own way of commuting as close to, or at least half way.

- Solicitation of sex

title: writing heals the soul - if you write you know what I'm talking about.
text:
I created this group to support writers who are going through some rough times 
(like myself) and might not only need to express themselves through writing, but 
writing what they are going through. 

Being 45 I thought this group, would be great for those around my age. We'll have 
more in common, I think. But again, it's not a "pre requisite". 

I know there are people out there who are hurting, who feel alone, or who just do 
to have anywhere else to express themselves. I'm not afraid of where the writing 
takes you. It could make you feel better, worse, or maybe you want to try and 
write something new - something completely out of character. That's what writing 
is all about. At least that's my philosophy. 

If someone needs support, I am here to listen but I don't want this group to end 
up wallowing in our sorrows until we drown. 

PEASE if you aren't going to participate then please don't join. Don't waste our 
time. There are people out there (including myself) who really need to connect to 
other writers now. 

Sometimes writing about the opposite of how you're feeling really works. Have 
you ever tried it? 

Email me and I will send you the information to join and I will approve your 
membership. If you only want to be a silent member I'll have to delete you..... 

Hope to meet some others who understand what it is I'm trying to do here..... 

The whole concept of this group that we all have pain and we can express it here, 
and get support. 

It would be an honor to get to know you.

title: ***Fun and Professional Friend***
text:
This is possible right? Right? Okay, so as I become a somewhat successful professional in the city, my friends are breaking off in these groups. First, the group that is getting married, off to the burbs, to start a family. Nothing wrong with that, I'm just not there yet. The second group is so consumed with work, I never see them. I respect that as well but I've learned all work and no play isn't fun. Finally, I have that group of friends, that really never grew up. They are fun to hang out with every now and then, but the older I get, the less we have in common. While I tend to enjoy going out more in the areas of downtown, river north etc, they are stuck in Wrigleyville. Oh, and try inviting them to a play or a networking event. Boy, you should see the looks on their faces :)

So that's is why I'm on CL. I'm hoping to find someone who is extremely fun and outgoing, but also has a professional side to them. They should enjoy going out as I don't mind staying out all night (I still have a few 4-5AM nights in me). But there is so much more to me than that. I also love fine dining, discussing current events over coffee, street fests museums, reading etc. I also attend a lot of after-work social/professional events, and huge plus if you do as well. Another huge plus if you're career driven as we'll just have more in common that way. City residents only...being friends with someone in the burbs is really tough from past experience. 

So if you're looking around your friend circle and would like to give it a refresh with a fun, outgoing and professional male, then send me a message. Please be serious when replying. While it's important we click, I don't want to send a ton of emails back and forth. If possible, maybe we could hang out next weekend. Three requests when replying:

1. Please put your favorite place in the city (bar/club/museum/restaurant whatever) in the subject line of the email
2. Tell me a bar/club/restaurant that you've been wanting to check out but haven't. 
3. How do you think the Chicago Cubs and/or White Sox will do this year? 

Thanks for reading the ad and really look forward to reading your responses.

title: Renaissance Man
text:
I don't think many haven given the thought on just how much time alone these people spent alone.
It's certainly unhealthy. They certainly weren't wealthy, and some even died with little to no proper credit until recent times, Tesla. It requires a very strong focused concentration. Zoned in; everything else around you becomes null. It's as if you live in this world were possibilities have just opened up, and you need to find a way to pull them into reality. 

Imagine your head will with ideas all day long, and not being able to resist the urge of fantasizing about the possibilities, and applicable ways it can be achieved. A lot of experimenting then ensues. If you want to be extremely well versed in something, why not study it extensively, or Practice it. 

I chuckle writing this part, because I can use myself as an example. I don't doubt I could have multiple degrees in the areas of computing, but life exactly isn't easy for someone who's always expresses depressive states, and becomes socially anxious at times. Even now I feel distant from the world. When I feel better I have no doubt I'll continue my readings, and tinkering away at things.

Moving on...

Could you imagine looking through a telescope for the first time, and seeing something that we now know as a planet, but at the time was something new, and extremely exciting. Such a beautiful feeling of discovery. In a more modern example - Archaeologists. 

I shall not further bore you. 
Enjoy the beautiful weather.

title: ...Help...
text:
This is gonna be rough. But if anyone has some kind words or advice, maybe an anecdote, I'd appreciate the gesture. At least read it. I'm here at three in the morning pouring my guts out, to anyone.

I've been seeing this girl on and off for a couple years. And I always kept her in my heart because of *what* I loved about her. But as time went on, more of what I didn't love would surface. The alcohol dependency, the medications, the lack of empathy and mood swings...

Then one night when we were out, her mood swings went haywire and she beat the living shit out of me, while I was trying to drive her home. She called the cops and they took her side. Bloodied and confused, I spent months in torment. The panic attacks, the anxiety; it never got better. I had only just finished payment and court in January, she did this in December of 2014.

It's hard... Being so in love with someone who doesn't dare change themselves for the better. In fact, we would fight about me asking her to tone down her drinking. Mixed with the pills, any alcoholic becomes an emotional nightmare.

But she never accepted that I wanted her to change for the better. She believed I wanted to restrict her friends and be the only one she talks to...

Then she cheated on me, and lied. She slept with a homeless guy she knew for all of a couple days and I didn't find out until the guy walked up and told me, on her 21st birthday... Maybe a week or two later.

More drama, more terrible decisions, and she finds herself in prison for six months (violent girl). I had since split with her, and a few months in, she writes to me. Telling me how wrong she was, how sorry she was. How things could change.

She was released in the end of January and immediately began drinking everyday, yet again. Though she had stopped taking some of her meds, she was still on a few, and they're not for a cold. 

Still, fighting little fights on and off, I thought about the future and fooled myself into believing she wanted to be a part of it. There was no changing her. The cute little happy-go-lucky, turtle-loving redhead is a facade.

She's hurt.
She's damaged.
She's drunk.
She's horny.
She's a mess.

So, one night her friend texts her "I love you" at 230 in the morning while we're watching a movie on her phone. I wouldn't have seen it otherwise. I'm mad that she's mad that I'm mad. Why can't I be concerned? Why can't I be upset? Because it all gets thrown in my face. I have friends, girls, who if they had texted me at 230 in the morning would be reading my obituary the next day.

So, days later. Today. She's wasted. We had fought yesterday and seemingly split until we made up later that night. All she wanted was to see me cry. To know that she could hurt me... 

Today... It's as if we hadn't made up at all. I'm moving out of my house because I can't afford it, I can't land a decent job because of her charges, and my anxiety and depression don't help the situation. 

We decide to meet up so we can release my snake together in a better setting than a glass box with no friends. As I let him out, she cracks a Budweiser from her pocket. I thought she said she wanted to film it.

We get back to her house and start smoking a bowl in her lot. She brings up how hard it will be now that I'm moving. That she wishes her mom was cool and I could stay over. I've told her before I'm not comfortable in her room after she cheated on me, and she gives me shit for having a relationship with someone while she was in prison, like it was a bad thing to do while she started seeing a guy as soon as I dumped her. 

From there it gets worse and I finally explode, telling her it's over, and after I had cried my eyes out to her just last night.

I sent her a text saying how I hope she gets sober, and that I had to leave. I had to or it would destroy me. 

She's fine. Out at a bonfire, drunk, probably already hooking up. Burning the letters she had wrote me in prison.

I'm not a wreck. I have aspirations in life, and I have motivation to follow them. I'm just hurt that someone I fell so in love with couldn't help herself. Didn't want to. Didn't try. Didn't believe I had her best interests in mind. Didn't want to believe she was the only one in my life I could love.

And here I lay, in the same room I lay in as a child. And like a child, I feel weak. Like I still have so much to suffer. It's anxiety. I can feel my love dying, like the next girl I date will experience my torment. 

Like a cancer. Or a cold sore.

title: all kinds of happiness
text:
There are any number of ways to be happy, although really, since happiness is a state of mind the only way to be happy is to decide to be happy. 

But, cheap philosophy aside, when I think about posting here it's difficult to come up with a strict list of what I want because there are any number of things that are enjoyable, fun, satisfying, and I'd be happy with any of them.

I'd be good with having an ongoing online conversation with someone interesting who just wants to share their day, or have a political discussion, or talk about family or anything at all.

I'd be happy having an online relationship with someone who likes to flirt, exchange fun pictures, as well as to talk about anything at all (see above).

I'd enjoy meeting someone who understand the challenges of a relationship that has been become posting body unfulfilling, although not horrible. Someone who understands the need to fill that hole in your heart but at the same time not turn your whole life inside out. And then if that person is also cute and likes to flirt......... and wants to have an ongoing conversation ........... see above.

If any of these things happen and then we also decide we want to meet, I would be open to that as well, but I'm in no rush. This is not about looking for a quick lay, this is about something more long term and satisfying ........ at any level, casual or as deep as you want to go.

title: Another One of Those Days
text:
The kind that blend into weeks, then into months. You ask yourself where the time is going. Everything changes. Nothing changes. You're surrounded by people, but yet feel alone. Conversations don't feel like conversations. Just words being shot at you. You want to give more, be more, but feel like the well is empty. You're always last. Even when something interesting happens, something makes it less so. 

From the outside, it all seems perfect. From the inside, you know it's not. You have friends, but lately, they seem like strangers. There's too much responsibility to escape from it all, so you move from one of those days just to the next.

You search for some type of connection, but it just isn't there.

title: NYC M seeks pen pal with All American wife, mom, overachiever
text:
You are the epitomy of "sexy" to me. You have learned how to balance all of life's pressures. You run your household flawlessly, you get the kids where they need to go on time, and you are a devoted wife and mother.

Perhaps you even balance all of the above AND a career, or perhaps you have given up your career to spend as much time as possible to be there for your children. 

You do all of the above, and yet you still find the time to look your best, to be fit and healthy, and to radiate youthfull exuberance. Perhaps you do this by sacrificing your own inner wants and desires that are bubbling beneath the surface.

Isn't it time for you to take care of yourself? Isn't it time that you did something just because YOU wanted to and not for someone else?

Behind those designer sun glasses, are you spending time wondering what it would be like to cut loose once in a while. 

Do you long for the heated passion, electricity, carnal desires that eminate from deep inside your body wanting to explode like a volcano in the south pacific? 

Your content on the one hand with your happy little family, but you have a secret fantasy or even desire to explore, longing to experience uninihibited passion and deep desire. 

I truly worship you and I hold you in the highest regard. I am so incredibly captivated by all of you, all that I described, and I hope that this post finds you well because I'd like to get to know you.

I am 6'5, 240, athletic build, brown eyes, warm smile, and loving heart. 

I posted in Chicago because I wanted to have a remote friend, not somone whree it would be easy to meet. I wanted someone where we could build up a strong and meaningful connection without being able to confirm the electricity easily. It's not so far that we can't meet in person one day, but it is so far that if we ever do meet, it will be well planned, very special, and probably one of the most amazing expereinces of our lives.

title: Looking for Couples
text:
Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago's Center for Gender, Sexuality and HIV Prevention is currently enrolling male couples in mixed HIV status relationships in a HIV medication adherence counseling study. You will be compensated for your time (up to $700 per couple) and receive free HIV and STI testing.

Here are the details:

Eligibility: 18 years or older, cis-gender men in same-gender-loving relationships with men who have a different HIV status than your own, and live in the Chicago land area (within a 50-mile radius from downtown; you must be able to travel to our office in Uptown). All relationship types are welcomed; you could be dating, living together, married, or maybe you just started something!

What you do: Complete an online pre-screener at strongertogether.us to see if you are eligible. If you and your partner are eligible, you'll be invited to come into our office to complete additional surveys and HIV and STI testing (includes blood draw and finger prick) and counseling.

Compensation: Each person will receive $50 for each completed appointment (If you are eligible, you and your partner could be invited to come back every 6 months, up to 24 months).

Please go to strongertogether.us to see if you're eligible to participate.

title: If you'll be my bodyguard I can be your long-lost pal
text:
I'm in the shitty position of having outgrown most of my friends, and being physically very distant from the handful I still like. However, like most Americans, I loathe and despise the process of making new friends, and furthermore am very bad at it. The awkward phase between meeting a person and elevating that to friendship seems like an impassable spike pit, and while it would be great to meet new people, dealing with that part of the interaction makes the worthwhile nature of the whole shebang seem increasingly nonexistent. 

So, just for laughs, here's a proposal. Talk to me like you already know me. This may seem like a difficult proposition as you know nothing about me other than my gender, age, and propensity for posting idiotic Craigslist ads, but just fake it. I won't know anything about you either but I fully intend to give any decent email a familiar response.

Anyway, if this sounds like your kind of dumb game, let me know.

title: Before you give up on life...read this
text: This book kept me up all night, last night. Sorry for posting, but I'm sure there is someone out there who needs help! ESCAPE FROM MARCY changed the way I see people and things; it made me look inward. When you are living in poverty, and your back is up against the wall, and there is no hope left to borrow from, and there is no escape out of hell, and there is an abyss staring back at you, and the thought of suicide hits you like a cold wind...what do you do? There is a man wearing a gray hoodie at the corner of Marcy Avenue & Flushing. He has something that will take the pain away and make you escape. He is the gatekeeper between heaven and hell; in his pockets are the keys. I'm trying hard to stay clean yo, and this book gave me something to hold on to when I see the abyss looking back at me, telling me to give up and cross over to the other side. Book is profound; it saved my life!

title: Did you come out as gay from 1982-1989?
text:
I recently decided to tell my story about what it was like to come out during these years and have realized the historical importance related to it. I would like to document as many stories as possible from those that came out when HIV/AIDS killed and was known as the "gay plague". If you're HIV negative or positive is of little importance for this project unless it is related to your coming out. Please note that I came out in 1987 and so I know that many of these stories will be as difficult for you to relive as mine certainly was. Everyone and every story will be treated with respect and compassion. If you are able to share your story with me please include the following...

1. Name - Your story can be annomous just please let me know if you're using an alias
2. Date you came out
3. Age you came out
4. Where you grew up
5. Where you came out

I am not sure where this project is going so I am also looking for people to collaborate with and planning a brainstorming type meeting at the end of April in Chicago. Don't let the physical location of the meeting discourage you from getting involved because we can set up a skype meeting if needed. 

Thank you for what you're doing today and what you did when you came out in the 1980's

title: So you tell me...
text:
...is it just a guy thing or is it a condition women experience too?

You see, by most accounts, my life is pretty good. I have a job I don't hate. I have a wife who adores me and two boys that are becoming fine young men. I have my health although I take it for granted. But even that feeling is starting to wane. I have hobbies and interests that keep me busy and provide me with a sense of purpose. So what's the problem? Why am I sitting here writing and posting on CL? it's not like anyone is going to read this anyway. 

So you tell me...is it a guy thing or is it a condition women experience too? 

It's not a hookup I seek. It's not a commitment to another woman I seek. I just feel despite all of the things that are positive in my life, that something is missing. 

Do you feel that way too? I really want to know if what I am experiencing is just a man wanting more than he has...which I don't think is true because if that was the case, I'd know and be able to pursue that avenue...or is it a condition that women feel too?

Is your life by all accounts pretty perfect? Do you have a husband that you're attracted to and kids that fill most of your days with satisfaction? Do you intellectually know your life is awesome but you still have to talk yourself into its awesomeness? That's what I'm talking about. Do you feel that way too? 

Is it because of the person you're with? Do you still find yourself wanting more and thinking there is someone out there who can take that empty part of you and fill it up? It seems so silly knowing all I know and seeing all I've seen. But yet, I still can't help but think there is. 

How about you? You tell me...am I just being a male pig or do women feel this way too?

title: Do you like to cuddle with your friends?
text:
Though I am not a stranger to strictly platonic cuddling, I think my life would be more fulfilling if I had another friend to cuddle with.

Cuddling can be a great way to connect with someone. Depending on how I and the other person are feeling in the moment, conversation during cuddling can be minimal (at the very least it is important to discuss boundaries) or extensive (conversation topics I like include art, philosophy, religion/spirituality, and social justice). We also have the option of cuddling while watching movies or listening to music.

I tend to prioritize women in all aspects of my life, including strictly platonic relationships, which is why I am posting here. The person I will be cuddling with will not have a problem with trans women (because I am a trans woman) or Jewish women (because I am a Jewish woman). For my part I do not discriminate on the basis of race or ethnicity.

Please note that I am posting to the ***strictly platonic*** section. Though I am a lesbian, I am taking a hiatus from romantic and sexual relationships, so my decision to post here was quite deliberate.

I can host, but before cuddling with anyone I will want to meet up in a public space where we would have the option of experiencing a minimal amount of physical contact, such as hand-holding, without getting glared at. I think a cafe works well for this, but I am open to other suggestions. If you think I might be interested in hearing from you, you should reply!

title: Looking for someone to text
text:
I work in a financial institution in the loop and thought everything in my life was all well and good. 
Then I got a news from my manager that the company was downsizing and they might lay off a bunch of us.
It was like getting electrocuted. I couldn't feel anything for a while. It felt like I'm in a dream or something. 
I was scared and I panicked. I didn't know what to do. 
Later that night when I went to bed I couldn't stop thinking about it.
And I realized that I got too scared that the scare vanished of fear. 
Then I started thinking what I was doing with my life 
where are am I going?
What is the purpose of my life?

Then the thought went on...
why should I have a purpose in my life?
Why should I prove that I'm successful or I'm making any money to someone?
Why should I care about the society?
I felt that I should get out from this rat race which not taking me anywhere.
I woke up next morning and it all felt like the movie fight club 
Things that I own have ended up owning me. 
I live in a 1 bedroom apartment alone. 
Why do I need a 1 bedroom?
Why do I need that leather recliner?
I don't eat on the table then why the fuck do I have a dining table and chairs?
So I decided to let them all go. 
So I go back to work and realized they are not firing me. 
But I have decided to keep that fire in me to give everything I don't need or require. 
I've decided to move to a smaller apartment not because I can't afford my current one it's just because I don't need it. 
I was talking to my friends about this and they call me crazy for leaving the bigger place and moving to a smaller one similarly they find it stupid to move out of a place when it is not a necessity whereas me, on the other hand, realize that the biggest advantage of living in an apartment is the mobility it provides. So I wanted to utilize it to the fullest. 

If u would like to talk to someone about stuff like this, Platonic relationship. No picture exchange required. I was looking for more like a pen pal. I would like to see whether there is someone who actually is into talking. I'm a movie buff who loves to eat burgers and bike around. 

If you think we could make an interesting conversation shoot me a message. I don't know l whom I'm looking for but I know for sure that I'm not looking for any trump supporters. :(

title: Looking for Friends
text:
GWM, looking for a new friend or two who would be interested in meeting for dinner, coffee, or a beer; attending concerts, festivals, museums, and other cultural experiences; taking short road trips to explore the world around us (well, whatever subset of the world can be explored from Chicago on a tank of gas or less); or just hanging out.

I work in a professional occupation and have a technology background. When not working I am involved in a few technical hobbies and volunteer work in my community, and (surprise!) I read, listen to music, and consume various other media. I'm fascinated by offbeat roadside attractions and the history and development of factories, roads, bridges, railroads, and airports. I tend to connect best with people who spend their leisure time on hobbies, crafts, music, art, or some other creative activities. I don't follow sports, celebrities, award shows, or social-media memes, and I don't watch much TV.

I like food but I'm not a "foodie". Fine dining is fine, but so is a good diner. I prefer good food and friendly service over vibe and ambiance, steak over sizzle, independents over chains, French toast over quiche, Gene & Jude's over Five Guys, and dog food over Pizza Hut.

Infrequent drinker. Non-smoker.

I hope to meet people who are smart, funny, and adventurous (though I am not).

Strictly platonic. I am not looking for dates, "dates", or hook-ups. Which means I'm not particular about your age, sex, or looks. And I'm not too concerned about your relationship status, as long as you have some free time to get together and do things, and you're in control of your own social calendar.

If interested, please drop me a line and let me know something about yourself, including your location and what you do for fun.

Thanks.

title: Does what I've written describe you?
text:
So, let me ask. Are you involved (bf, husband), but find yourself bored? Are you sort of happy, but can't shake that nagging feeling that you're not completely happy? Do you miss the excitement of hearing from someone, be it an email or a text, that is new to you? You know, those butterflies you start to feel waiting to see a new email in your inbox, or a new text message? 

You find yourself wondering what your life would be like if you could rewind back to before you got involved, or tied the knot. You wonder if you'd be happier. You wonder if we choose our paths in life, or if the paths choose us. Mostly, you question why you even wonder about it at all. But you do. That's party of the reason why you're here reading this now.

Are you intelligent, funny, compassionate, with a good head on your shoulders? Do you ever daydream about things you probably shouldn't, but the ideas give you that wonderful nervous feeling you miss too?

Would you love to have a new friend to talk to every day, discretion required. Someone who gives you the butterflies again, someone who makes you laugh, makes you think, someone who listens, someone who shares... but mostly, someone that reminds you you're not alone in feeling the way you do about your life...

title: Married Only, Please
text:
Since you decided to click on this ad, I imagine you must at the very least meet the above criteria. . ... Coupled with this, I'm guessing there are also other factors which brought you here. . ...

I'm placing this ad for the same reasons. While we may not have imagined this is something we're capable of. . ...well. . ...here we are. . . looking, longing and wanting the things we thought the commitment to our partners would bring us. . ..

So, where do we go from here? While I initially accepted my situation for many years. . ... I've given this a lot of thought and have decided to be responsible for my own happiness. I also realize there are many of us in this situation, we who do not want to disrupt the family life or marriage but looking to feel wanted, needed, cared about. . .. . .

What if we decided to explore this together? What if we could bring each other the things missing in our marriages? What if we could make each other fulfilled? What if we could make each other smile again?

I'd love to hear from you if you care to explore with me. . ..

Thanks!

title: Does anyone know what "platonic" means?
text:
As my headline suggests does anyone here truly know what the word means? Because going through some ads I've seen people looking for nudists, a "boy toy" or "young professionals" looking for "inshape" guys to do things with. Because a fat person can't keep up with you and your extravagant shenanigans (clubbing...let's be honest) around the city? I mean, I know that's not what some of you are implying you're more or less looking for people whom you have a lot in common with but if the person is a carbon copy of yourself how fun is that? You may as well just carry a full length mirror with you everywhere.

Which brings me to my second point. How can anyone find a "friend" via fetishes (nudists for example)? Some of you should be posting in the "casual encounters" section or strictly "m4m" section. And some of you sound like you're looking for a date in which case the "misc romance" section is what you should be using. 

I'm not trying to be a killjoy but it's a bit annoying to weed through all of these ads to find someone who truly knows what this section is for ...... socially awkward misfits. I kid! Lol in case you haven't figured it out I'm a bit of a comedian. Basically I'm awesome and you should flood inbox like a hurricane pummeling a southern state.

Now, here's where I attempt being serious (bear with me). Being in this community is as we all know a bit isolating. My straight friends and I get along swimmingly (I seem to have a water theme going on don't I?) but they're all getting married and starting families and here I am, the single, gay, odd one out with more disposable income because I'm not a breeder and I have all the time in the world at my disposal, except for when I'm working (I do work!) and most of my gay friends have either tried to get in my pants either sexually or to just try them on ...... both instances are awkward! Or things ended up weird (feelings developed). 

My recent ex gay bff is a heroin addict that I've since stopped hanging out with because I felt he could potentially get me into trouble and the sad part is he was more reliable than any of my sober friends. But I can't sit there and watch someone kill themself, I've tried to help him, I truly did. But I can't be around that.

As much as I love the times that we're living in, especially tech wise, it would be nice to just find a friend I can connect with on an intellectual level. Someone I can hangout with and watch iconic 80s movies with while both of us have our phones turned off (*gasp* a mortal sin I know!) Someone I can Netflix and chill with without the "chill" being a euphemism for sex. Someone who knows how to play poker, gin rummy and spades and hell, even uno will suffice. Also, does anyone play old school video games? I mean games you had to play on your own without any help from people you don't know an ocean away? It seems even the most dimwitted sorority girls call themselves "gamers" now.

I'm quick with a joke, and have voice impressions to go along with my humor so I know you'll be laughing, if not you probably just suck as a person, sorry to say, but someone had to say it right? If you're ready for a true friend for once in your life, message me.

Peace

title: Someone to watch anime with.
text:
I'm looking for a cute girl to get to know and watch some Anime! 

I'm totally a closet anime fan! I have been for some time, but now it's time to step out and spread my nerdy, anime-loving wings and fly. 

I always watch Toonami on saturday night and whatever shows happen to be on... and I really enjoy pretty much every show that they put on. I'd definitely like to watch some new stuff I've never seen before, any suggestions you'd like to watch with me?

Bleach was straight up wicked cool, Naruto, Kill La Kill was awesome, Code Geass, Deathnote, Dragonball Z, One Piece, I fell in love with Attack on Titan last year, and I'm sure there are a few I'm not thinking of that I enjoyed. 

As a closet fan, I was exposed to a very very limited amount of anime. Finally I decided that their is a lot more out there for me to see. I only now just started to go through the Miyazaki films, and I've got plenty more to go. 

A bit about me: I'm 26 years old, average build, tall with dark features and currently sporting a goatee. I live at home with my family at the moment, but plan on getting out on my own as soon as I can afford to do so. 

If we get together to hang and watch shows I'd prefer it be at your place since I don't live on my own. My house isn't exactly...shall we say...people friendly. 

If you made it this far, you're probly wondering"is this guy really just looking for a friend?" The answer is...mostly yea. Confused? I need someone new in my life. The intention here is for friends, but im not opposed to more happening if there's chemistry. I'd like to talk to you, hang out, and see what we have in common. Presumably a love of anime, and a little more. If we don't have any chemistry between us, then I'm still totally down for being friends that both enjoy anime, among other nerdy things perhaps? 

Please be somewhere near the Aurora/Naperville area. And by "near", I mean like within a 30 minute drive preferably. If you live in the city...well...not ideal, but I may be willing to come see you and hang out as long as you'd be willing to come my way from time to time. Also, please be at least 21, and no older than 32. 

So I think that's about it. feel free to email me with questions, comments, suggestions, etc... Hope to hear from someone cute, nerdy, and nearby!

I tend to connect best with people who spend their leisure time on hobbies, crafts, music, art, or some other creative activities. I don't follow sports, celebrities, award shows, or social-media memes, and I don't watch much TV.

I like food but I'm not a "foodie". Fine dining is fine, but so is a good diner. I prefer good food and friendly service over vibe and ambiance, steak over sizzle, independents over chains, French toast over quiche, Gene & Jude's over Five Guys, and dog food over Pizza Hut.

Infrequent drinker. Non-smoker.

I hope to meet people who are smart, funny, and adventurous (though I am not).

Strictly platonic. I am not looking for dates, "dates", or hook-ups. Which means I'm not particular about your age, sex, or looks. And I'm not too concerned about your relationship status, as long as you have some free time to get together and do things, and you're in control of your own social calendar.

If interested, please drop me a line and let me know something about yourself, including your location and what you do for fun.

Thanks.

title: Miss Feeling Connected
text:
It isn't a specific person.
But it is just one, not many, just one.
Though maybe a friend or two are made along the way.

It's hard feeling lonely, when you aren't alone.
You aren't "supposed" to feel that way.
The bonds that used to make you feel connected are gone.
And now it feels like being in a bind, trapped.
It isn't unbearable, but it isn't what it was supposed to be.

What ever happened to laughter?
to polite conversation?
to deep conversation?
to gazing into someone's eyes, never wanting to look away?

Did the sharing of dreams and aspirations stop?
or did dreaming simply stop?
It wasn't supposed to be this way.

An incidental touch would send shivers
Holding would last hours,
but touches faded, gazes left
and dreaminess woke up
and the warm comfortable covers
gave way to cold loneliness

Though not alone

And I wonder why it would be so wrong
To want to escape to an oasis of rest
A place of smile and laughter
Over a simple drink or meal.

Or even a light touch,
with friendship, understanding and caring
Perhaps that tingle when lips embrace

Would it be so wrong?
When the one who could, or should, grant it, never wishes too

And maybe there is someone else in the same boat
Tired of rowing in circles, afraid of drowning in the sea
And they would like to feel their feet on dry land again
Perhaps even in the clouds.

Not forever, but time to time

To feel alive again

title: ... It's a Strange Strange Place ...
text:
It's a strange strange place
To lay awake all night in bed
And it's a strange sad place
To walk through life half dead

Reaching for the the night stand again
Grasping and groping to find a pen
To write down rhymes and songs
They fade so fast, never lasting long

It's a strange strange life
That dreams disappear when we wake
It's a strange sad life
Life is real and dreams are fake

I've been a sinner, and I've been a lover
They both have robbed my nights
So now I just sing other folk's covers
Trying to sleep and avoid the light.

It's a strange strange place
Where you live for a wish
It's a strange sad place
When you live just to exist.

It's a strange strange life
That we go walking through
It's a strange sad life
They, and them, and you, I never knew

It's a strange strange place
Wanting someone to help you sleep in the night
And It's a strange sad place
Wanting someone to help wake you to the light

title: Platonic With A Kick
text:
I know I'm in the platonic section, but I've tried the other ones and there seems to be no real people over there so as a last resort, I'm over here. I wish there was an easy way to explain what I'm looking for, and a proper category to post in, but there isn't. I want to find a friend, a companion, a buddy to goof around with and yes...a lover. I am your basic, everyday, normal American male. I am married, 48 years old, and doing my best to stay in shape. I have what I consider to be a good outlook on life, all things considered. I can be serious when the situation calls for it, but can be a goofball as well. I love making people laugh and enjoy being spontaneous. 

Now about you. Looks, race and age don't really matter as long as we can connect on many different levels. Be ready to talk and communicate. You don't have to be a genius, but have your own opinions on things and be confident enough to express them. Sarcasm is great and a little flirtatious is always nice. Other than that, just be yourself. We can figure the rest out as we go along.

So what do you think? Is this you? Am I someone you've been looking for? If so, let me know so we can get this adventure started. Please send me at least a few sentences about yourself and your situation so I know you're real. Thanks for reading this and have a wonderful day.

title: Cuddling Does Something Very Surprising to Your Health
text:
I am looking for someone who would like to cuddle and spoon. Someone who likes to be held or to hold me. I am very easy going. I can host, or you can host or a neutral hotel. There are many health benefits to this.......

If interested read the following. Or simply send a response telling about yourself and we can take it from there. Open to anyone. Male or female. Must have good hygiene!!! Casual, cloths on, non sexual. Possibly a massage. Open to ideas. An awesome experience for both parties. Drug and Disease free. 

This is what I found on the internet.....

If you can't get close enough to your significant other (or non-significant other), scientific studies have your back, quite literally. As it turns out, cuddling might as well be a miracle drug.

Most of us already know that cuddling with someone, be it our pets, best friends, partners or kids, makes us feel cozy, safe and warm. It's what we want to do when it's drafty in our apartments, or when The Walking Dead is on and we can't handle watching zombies take big sloppy bites out of humans alone, or when we're just bummed out and need a soft surface to lay our heads.

But could snuggling be scientifically proven to be healthy? Thank goodness -- the answer is yes. Here are five reasons why:

1. Cuddling makes us happier.
When you're physically close to someone, you tend to feel happier and healthier. According to Women's Health Magazine, "touching someone releases [dopamine and serotonin], both of which can boost your mood and curb depression." 

Furthermore, when a person is physically close to someone, his or her body releases oxytocin, another "happy chemical" that contributes to us cultivating and maintaining intimate, healthy relationships. According to Paul Zak, an expert on the beloved hormone and self-proclaimed "Dr. Love," oxytocin is the "moral molecule behind all human virtue, trust, affection and love, a 'social glue' that keeps society together." A hand hold, a snuggle, a hug -- all of these actions supposedly increase levels of oxytocin.

Oxytocin isn't necessarily a miracle molecule, of course. Jennifer Bartz from the Mount Sinai School of Medicine, for example, discovered that the effects of oxytocin really depend on an individual's personality and perspective, according to Slate. But several studies have pointed to the molecule's ability to promote "feelings of devotion, trust and bonding" between people, giving oxytocin its title of "the bonding hormone." 

2. Cuddling can strengthen our immune systems.
Intimacy is healthy. The human touch has been shown to drop a person's levels of cortisol, the main biological culprit of stress. As Roberta Lee of Beth Israel Medical Center in New York explains, "Cortisol suppresses the immune response. Anything that increases the relaxation response triggers the restoration of your immune response."

The result: Your body is more able to fight off viruses and inflammation, making you happier and healthier. 

3. Cuddling makes us less anxious.
Not only does close proximity to other humans make you feel happier, it can also decrease your worries and anxiety. When you touch someone, the skin-on-skin contact signals your adrenal glands to cease excessive amounts of cortisol production, the aforementioned stress hormone.

"Having this friendly touch, just somebody simply touching our arm and holding it, buffers the physiological consequences of this stressful response," Matt Hertenstein of DePauw University told NPR.

James Coan, an assistant professor at the University of Virginia, conducted a study that illustrated the helpfulness of the human touch, specifically hand holding. While administering MRIs, he warned 16 married women that they might "experience shock." Each woman's state of anxiety was instantly illuminated in the MRI scans. But when these women held each other's hands for comfort, their elevated stress response subsided. When their husbands held their hands, the ladies grew even more relaxed.

"There was a qualitative shift in the number of regions in the brain that just weren't reacting anymore to the threat cue, Coan told CNN. As Coan and his colleagues noted in their paper on the study, marital hand-holding influenced the neural activation in the hypothalamus, which in turn influences the release of cortisol.

4. Cuddling could help us sleep better.
Oxytocin does more than help us bond and potentially increase happiness. Since increased levels of oxytocin help you relax and reduce high blood pressure, it could also be connected with better sleep alongside your partner, Rachel E. Salas of the Johns Hopkins Center for Sleep suggested.

Moreover, studies have found "suggestive evidence that couples' emotional closeness and physical intimacy during the daytime and prior to bedtime may promote sleep," which we'd presume makes each bed partner happier -- read: less grumpy -- the next day. So get your eight hours with your significant other or another warm body by your side. 

5. Cuddling goes hand-in-hand with closer relationships.
Studies have shown that couples that regularly cuddle and snuggle in bed are most likely in healthier relationships.

"One of the most important differences involved touching. Ninety-four percent of couples who spent the night in contact with one another were happy with their relationship, compared to just 68% of those that didn't touch," Richard Wiseman, a psychologist at the University of Hertfordshire in England told the Telegraph. While 68% isn't the lowest number in the world, 94% would seem to reflect positively on the effectiveness of cuddling and touching at night. 

Moreover, couples who used to be more physically affectionate but have since cut back on cuddling could potentially be in bad shape. According to Wiseman, "If you have a couple who used to sleep close together but are now drifting further apart in bed, then that could [be] symptomatic of them growing apart when they are awake."

The bottom line? Cuddling is definitively excellent. So if you want to spend the evening cuddled up on the couch with the closest person you can find, you should. Because science says so, and you would be doing your body some good.

Keep calm and spoon on.

Thank you for reading. Best Regards.

I had two female second cousins (who were unmarried) and with whom I shared a very close bond. I muss the good times we shared and would like to build that kind of relationship again. I am a bit of a homebody who enjoys visiting friends at home and having friends also come to my apartment to visit me.

I am a well-educated, conservative man who is 5' 10", 190 lbs., with brown hair and eyes. I am totally self-sufficient, and I live in a high-rise apartment building in East Lake View. I am looking for absolutely nothing but friendship and someone to build happy memories with. This, I believe, can get difficult as one grows older. By the way, I am a gay man who is currently single.

I consider myself a caring, considerate, well-groomed individual who has both integrity and compassion. I am intelligent, and I try to remain relevant, though I have resisted the cell phone craze and social media. Nevertheless, I am not technologically challenged, and, of course have a computer and work from my home. I read a great deal, and I was a member of a writers' group for almost twenty years.

I am currently single, a professional writer and columnist who had a byline of my own for five years. I also worked in the Corporate World for thirty some years. So, I believe I come to the table with something to offer.

If, perhaps, I have struck a familiar chord, please write to me and tell me something about yourself. As I do not drive, I prefer to meet a friend (or friends) who live in the Lincoln Park-Lake View areas of the city.

I can't wait to learn something about you. Maybe a solid friendship will develop. At any rate, why should we both be lonely? Let's take a chance.

Thanks for reading. I hope you'll be moved to respond. My name, by the way, is David.

title: Looking for help from compassionate person
text:
I've been a Chicago resident for over 7 years, until I met a producer and pitched a concept that involved my family and friends and former coworkers. I have asked repeatedly to have no further involvement with the project but no matter what I do, I am unable to remove myself from it. I have experienced my phone being tampered with and any attempts I have made to speak with law enforcement or attorneys are ignored and prevented by people who are associated with it. I worked as a server in restaurants, made a comfortable living that way and didn't hurt or bother anyone. With the assistance of my former lover, there were cameras placed in my home without my knowledge, and while using this website, was subjected to meeting people who were paid to have sex with me, one of them being my cousin who I was unaware that it was him. I have tried to seek employment by replying to craigslist ads and each place that I was either hired at or interviewed at had an affiliation with this project despite my numerous statements that I didn't want to continue with it. I have been drugged, had things done to me while I was unconscious, held against my will in places I didn't want to be at, had police reports I tried to initiate falsified or refuted, and have had cameras placed in each residence that I have stayed in since moving from what was a private residence, even when I was paying rent to stay there without being told that I was being recorded. I have had friends of mine that wouldn't allow me to stay with them because I was told that they like to have their privacy, however reaching out to them was my attempt at getting my privacy back. I did not knowingly agree to anything of this length and was under the impression that I would be able to remove myself from any further involvement and be able to return to my life as it was without any obligation. I have repeatedly requested a copy of anything I have signed and have not been able to have that request adhered to. Through seperate pitches I made of no connection to my project, I have helped bring tv shows and movies to the Chicago area that helped stimulate the economy of our town by over 300 million dollars just last year. Chances are, you may work somewhere where I have helped put money into your pocket and hopefully make your life better. These were not brought to Chicago on condition of making my life unbearable and uncomfortable. My rights to privacy have been violated, and I can't seem to get anyone to help me that doesn't want to help in any other way but continuing to participate in what I'm involved in. After I was under the impression that I was no longer affiliated with the project, I returned to Chicago and tried to get back to the normalcy I enjoyed before having my life disrupted trying to get out of something I never wanted to have happen. I know it's silly for me to probably post in here, however I'm hoping that someone who reads this might be able to provide me with any information that could help me. If you reply, it can be completely anonymous, but if your reply could include any contact information for an attorney that you may know or look up for me that can be of assistance, or any related press you may be able to find about it, or any link to any live streaming that has made people capable of viewing me without my permission, any help would be greatly appreciated. I've told numerous people that I didn't want to participate in this as early as November 2013, and I was ignored and coerced into participating, due to some things that have happened to people I care about as a result of them hearing a tape recording of me saying such things that I wouldn't want them to do because it would cause them harm. I've stressed that I don't want to be in tv, movies, or on the internet in any sort of show or project, so if you can find any evidence of this, please let me know. Chicago is home to me, and I was forced to either sleep outside while I was there or participate, and since I felt I couldn't do any more if either of those options, I was forced to come down to Florida, which to me, is a punishment I don't deserve after helping so many people. Please help me in any way that you can. 

Dewayne Carter

title: Someone to watch anime with.
text:
I'm looking for a cute girl to get to know and watch some Anime! 

I'm totally a closet anime fan! I have been for some time, but now it's time to step out and spread my nerdy, anime-loving wings and fly. 

I always watch Toonami on saturday night and whatever shows happen to be on... and I really enjoy pretty much every show that they put on. I'd definitely like to watch some new stuff I've never seen before, any suggestions you'd like to watch with me?

Bleach was straight up wicked cool, Naruto, Kill La Kill was awesome, Code Geass, Deathnote, Dragonball Z, One Piece, I fell in love with Attack on Titan last year, and I'm sure there are a few I'm not thinking of that I enjoyed. 

As a closet fan, I was exposed to a very very limited amount of anime. Finally I decided that their is a lot more out there for me to see. I only now just started to go through the Miyazaki films, and I've got plenty more to go. 

A bit about me: I'm 26 years old, average build, tall with dark features and currently sporting a goatee. I live at home with my family at the moment, but plan on getting out on my own as soon as I can afford to do so. 

If we get together to hang and watch shows I'd prefer it be at your place since I don't live on my own. My house isn't exactly...shall we say...people friendly. 

If you made it this far, you're probly wondering"is this guy really just looking for a friend?" The answer is...mostly yea. Confused? I need someone new in my life. The intention here is for friends, but im not opposed to more happening if there's chemistry. I'd like to talk to you, hang out, and see what we have in common. Presumably a love of anime, and a little more. If we don't have any chemistry between us, then I'm still totally down for being friends that both enjoy anime, among other nerdy things perhaps? 

Please be somewhere near the Aurora/Naperville area. And by "near", I mean like within a 30 minute drive preferably. If you live in the city...well...not ideal, but I may be willing to come see you and hang out as long as you'd be willing to come my way from time to time. Also, please be at least 21, and no older than 32. 

So I think that's about it. feel free to email me with questions, comments, suggestions, etc... Hope to hear from someone cute, nerdy, and nearby!

title: Just looking for a stranger to talk to
text:
So don't know how to put this and sorry if I'm being a buzz kill.?

Call me Dan, for all intensive purposes. I'm in my early/mid 20s.... Great job, friends, single should be living it up right? I'm depressed, shocker I know, who saw that coming. I don't want to talk to anyone I know, just want a third party unbiased perspective from a woman. I wouldn't feel right being this exposed emotionally with a man. I've never shared this info with anyone, I've always tried to bullshit my life to cover up my thoughts. I've done a great job of that if I may say so myself. I just want to be open and honest with someone for the first time in my life and just get this weight off my shoulders. I'm not looking for you to resolve my issues, you'll soon understand that they're not resolveable. I just figured It might help to finally open up once before I become engulfed in the inevitably gloomy life I'm destined for. Again main thing here is I don't want a pity party, if that were the case I'd of done this in person already.

title: just wishing one of my days could be a little more simple
text:
single female...not really having a friend to trust..; feeling like i don't have many options to meet people or try to talk in any interesting way....feeling like anyone meets me only for a last resort of someone to talk to. i thought i liked talking to people but i get a lot of hang up calls. 

just wishing for some way to not be lied to and things like that. maybe it's too late...i feel like i have a cloud over my head ...; stuff that i 'think' might work out..never hardly does.

not wanting to lose all hope yet...but extra timid. feels like been having a heart break without being able to overcome it...; was someplace once...and heard someone talking..., i keep getting these rise and fall hopes...like..will it actually be a good day to talk to someone...

whenever i try to write...sometimes i stop writing because i'm scared people already made up their mind not to like me and things...i might have to give up hopes, but maybe there would be someone somewhere to write to as a friend...., still would be doubtful, but trying anyway.. sorta having bad luck with most anything and trying not to have to leave the country. I've had many days ruined by i don't know where i got all the bad luck.. pretty much feels like daggers are coming my way in some way or the other...yet what else to try than to put thoughts here and try to be friends with someone. have not found anyone to trust without it turning into some kind of ...thing where i feel like there's no chance..

anyway, i like to just say hi to anyone nice...so just pretending i didn't get all my hopes blown before...

what happened to me...i heard a man next to me say..scary things...that the minute i try to trust anything...even if I'm not consciously thinking about it.....; i don't know...i just feel like i lost some kind of popularity contest ..and don't want to surface cause too embarrassed...

everything is limited-like...I'm just on my own...no one to talk to trustfully..., feeling too much like I'm always too desperate...- i have no hope that it'll ever change so far ...., i just am bummed out...I'd rather disappear than to try to look for one more friend...mostly i just get these rivalries happening, and i can't ever feel like i can meet anyone trustful..; i feel whipped already and put in my place and don't know how to overcome any feelings things with anyone nice. ..or develop good feelings with anyone. without someone trying to ruin my day...i just have no where to look, and I'm almost running out of years....so I'm stuck..

I've got this awful heartbreak and I'm scared no one will like me because of being not exactly perfect ever or...; just would like to make new memories...what can i say..

title: love is the challenge
text:
Great women keep great company. I have noticed that after 30 most if not all of the great women are spoken for. Being a guy in my early 40's that presents quite the challenge. Obviously my goal is marriage and kids. There need to be a strategy since I am not going to be hanging at younger venues or fish for a younger circle. Logically the woman I want is taken but that taken person probably has a similar circle of female friends. I think I am pretty amazing and from a male perspective I noticed that 70 percent of my male friends are just like me. You are the company you keep. 

This will sound crazy but I need dating practice. I get dates but the second or third date not so much. I need a woman to tell me what I am doing wrong. I would like to chill with a bottle of wine appetizers and talk about chicago dating from their perspective. Also that amazing woman my be conducting an interview for her amazing similar female single friend(hint hint)? Everyone knows someone that is amazing and single. In dating timing is everything.

I could use high end dating sites but those are really woman looking for sugar daddies. I know that from actual experience. I don't need to pay a company to find me a sugar baby. Heck seems like the world is trending towards everyone is selling something anyway. No desire for coin operated in my world. Is that the kind of woman you want to raise a child with? What if I pass away and the kids are left with that superficial ideal. Definitely not my ideal situation for that reason alone. 

To be exact I need an amazing woman that is already taken by an amazing man to tell me what he did to catch her eye. Talk about the guys that failed, the one's that came close and why the guy you are with stood out. Dating in a major city is different and logically only an amazing woman can tell me what amazing women are looking for.

I am a bit entitled so prepare yourself for something fancy and please be verbally exceptional. I need brilliance to help me figure out dating here since I am here for the long haul. The picture would be my normal attire. Probably cause I am always working or networking.

I am a normal guy with a planned schedule. Gym work gym eat healthy repeat. My friends describe me as an athlete nerd and I am fine with that lol. I am single no kids engaged once but never married. That relationship took 10 years from my dating time line. People don't waste 10 years on a person like I did. Learn from my lesson!!!

title: Any younger women seeking older, mature friend?
text:

I would like to go out and do the things friends do: see a movie, get coffee, grab some food, etc. We can have silly conversations that go nowhere AND meaningful conversations that go deep. title: I know you're tired of not having that perfect guy friend...
text:
Let's face it.. Since the beginning of time, there's been this weird thing about guys and gals and friendship..

Forget all that, because I've had amazing female friends in the past.. but that was in highschool. 

We'd be laughing all the time because we knew what made each other laugh, we'd always poke fun at each other, talk crap to each other and tease each other.. 

You know, the type to get separated by the teacher and moved to the far sides of the room because we'd always be talking and laughing and whispering while the teacher was trying to teach

and when we got into problems with other guys or other females, we'd have each others backs like "you woulda kicked his ass.. i know it.. good thing u didnt fight though" or "she's just hating because she wishes she can be like you".. that moral support thats far more validating than when it's coming from friends of your own gender..

However, life takes us down paths, we learn lessons and life isn't as simple as it was back in highschool.. and some of us don't go to college.. 

What I'm like: ALOT to handle for some.. But an amazing personality, great sense of humor, sarcastic, confident, tough but also a goofball, caring, considering, but also a loveable asshole

My preference: I'm open to every race.. especially girls who are a little ADD, because i'm the same way ... we're different than most and we have way more fun. If you get along with guys more than gals, maybe that'll help too.

title: Breath of Fresh Air
text:
Please read on if you're really looking for a TRULY platonic relationship, and you know that doesn't mean a means to an emotional or physical relationship. If you know that you have a tendency to not be able to resist an urge to pursue physical and/or emotional relationships with people you're close to I'm probably not a good fit for you. 

I'll start with what will be obvious and the "elephant in the room" if or when we meet. I am a completely eligible, single, attractive (more than my mothers opinion here), and professionally successful male with all the hallmarks of a "lock him up quickly" lifestyle. No children, ambitious, educated, and genuinely a good guy. I'm 36 but look 25, 6'2", 190lbs, fit, and can walk into most environments and attract the attention of the women in the room. I work in Finance, have an MBA from a local university in Chicago, and a rewarding career. So I'm sure you question is why the hell am I on CL and why the hell am I posting in the platonic section. I'm not naive enough to think that this will be received without skepticism, but to most women my explanation will make complete sense once you get passed the initial "yea, right...whatever" thought. So keep an open mind and read on.

Why I am looking for a purely non-physical relationship? Why is a friendship more important to me now than anything else? It's simple. Prior to my last relationship which ended 2 years ago I developed a friendship with a young woman. No sex. No flirting. No late night quiet storm phone calls. We hung out, talked politics, art, business, culture, went to ball games, etc. We hung out alone, in groups, and when we were dating we doubled. She became my best friend and most valued relationship other than my girlfriend. My girlfriend and I eventually broke up (she relocated and it was an amicable split), and six months later my friend got married. I was happy for her but her new husband was/is not comfortable with our relationship. I get it. I'm a dude and I know what most of us men think about platonic relationships, but outliers like myself end up suffering as a result. My friend and I don't hang out anymore as I respect her marriage and family life and don't want to complicate that. I've been single on purpose other than casual dating as my travel schedule up until the last few months was intense and not a good setup for a relationship, but I'm craving something like what I had before. Different than what my buddies provide. You get that, right? So what am I looking for?

You should be 30-45 and single or with an incredibly secure guy who has no sense of insecurity about you and male friends (yea right!). Race is unimportant as I couldn't care less about your skin color. Nothing about your person that you had no control over will factor into my consideration about you. Please don't be superficial. Humor is important. An active lifestyle is critical. An awareness of the world is valued. And ambition will help bind us. We can start by messaging but will need to meet face-to-face for coffee or a drink quickly so I know you're a real person. I'm not the pen pal type so I wouldn't be a good fit just to msg with. Also, you will have to be comfortable with me having casual relationships with women which shouldn't be a problem since you wouldn't be reading or responding to me if you can't control your emotions in this area. The goal would be a wing-man/wing-girl thing happening. Bottom-line? If you want to get to know a dude who has control over his urges and won't see you as a predatory means to a conquering end, hit me up. Here's a little more about me.

ISTJ (Google it). Intellectual. Edgy. An analytic on one side and a creative on the other. I write fictional literature and music and play the drums. Former college basketball player turned corp exec. I love running and playing ball. I can dance, am a foodie (ethiopian, tapas, and mexican to the top of the list for me), and can cook a little. Assertive yet thoughtful. Humble but confident. Caring but despise BS. And finally, I'm a lot of fun and will require us to have pressure free fun when we're together. I work in the burbs, live in the city, and don't care where you live cause we can connect while I'm in the burbs or at home in the city.

Please put "Fresh Air" in the subject line to weed out spam. I will not respond, period, if "Fresh Air" is not in the subject line. Oh, and the pic is me but it shouldn't matter one way or the other.

title: Mr. Romantic
text:
Hi.

Mr. Romantic here, partnered, but here alone for work reasons for a stint, in need of giving TLC to a girl/woman/lady who knows what TLC is.

I'm a little tired of seeing guys not look after (which is not to put their arm over the girls shoulder, as if to say "she's with me") a girl. I'm tired of guys not treating her like she's special (while out, he's looking at his phone: even 1 time). I'm tired of guys not knowing, let alone not asking, what the girl might like (maybe sometimes putting his arm over her shoulder). I'm tired of guys not giving her freedom (instead of only listening and looking at her, he's looking around to see which guys are looking at their girl). And all this without going into details about how some guys talk about their 'possessions' when they're "with the guys".

What happened to spending time kissing and caressing to some slow Janet Jackson or Roberta Flack? What happened to lying naked under the sheets while watching a movie and caressing (not fondling), and building expectation and desire. Or spending time in the whirlpool in bathing suits, embracing, brushing up against each other, creating that expectation (not just going in naked and for sex right-up). What happened to giving a relaxing massage under the shower, maybe still in swimming clothes, with no rush, just to spend more time kissing and caressing?

I just wish the girls would raise their expectations from guys and not settle for less. Or maybe invent that their female friend "has a boyfriend that ..." some of the above.

And then here you have, on the other side, a gentlemanly and chivalrous, romantic and sensual, suit & tie professional who is here alone for work reasons who seeks to give these things, on a spontaneous, yet somewhat sporadic, non-binding, to a girl who would like these things. As a mature 50 year-old appearing 40 (I'm told), in shape, white male, age is not an issue. And sincerely, while resting (or otherwise) on a bed, or in a pool, for me, height isn't an issue. But as it may be for some, I'm 5' 6" - 5' 7" (I think). Because for me looking after my appearance, being in shape and being handsome always, a woman's appearance is important to me: as a sign of her taking pride in herself. Being half-European, half-Mexican, I'd be interested in Caucasian or Mexican. I'm clean in all regards (no diseases, no drugs, no smokes, no drinks except a good wine in good company, or Bailey's).

Having put things out on the table, I hope I've entertained your reading with the truth. If you write back, very good. If not, I wish us all the best.
